verses.text: But king Solomon loved many strange women , together with the daughter of Pharaoh , women of the Moabites , Ammonites , Edomites , Zidonians , \add and\add* Hittites ;\f + \fr 11.1 \ft together…: or, beside\f*

Of the nations \add concerning\add* which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto the children of Israel , Ye shall not go in to them, neither shall they come in unto you: \add for\add* surely they will turn away your heart after their gods : Solomon clave unto these in love.
And he had seven hundred wives , princesses , and three hundred concubines : and his wives turned away his heart.

For it came to pass, when Solomon was old , \add that\add* his wives turned away his heart after other gods : and his heart was not perfect with the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* his God , as \add was\add* the heart of David his father.
For Solomon went after Ashtoreth the goddess of the Zidonians , and after Milcom the abomination of the Ammonites.\f + \fr 11.5 \ft Milcom: also called, Molech\f*

And Solomon did evil in the sight of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and went not fully after the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, as \add did\add* David his father.  +  r 11.6  t went…: Heb. fulfilled not after *
Then did Solomon build an high place for Chemosh , the abomination of Moab , in the hill that \add is\add* before Jerusalem , and for Molech , the abomination of the children of Ammon.
And likewise did he for all his strange wives , which burnt incense and sacrificed unto their gods. \p

¶ And the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* was angry with Solomon , because his heart was turned from the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* God of Israel , which had appeared unto him twice ,
And had commanded him concerning this thing , that he should not go after other gods : but he kept not that which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* commanded.

Wherefore the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto Solomon , Forasmuch as this is done of thee, and thou hast not kept my covenant and my statutes , which I have commanded thee, I will surely rend the kingdom from thee, and will give it to thy servant.\f + \fr 11.11 \ft is done…: Heb. is with thee\f*
Notwithstanding in thy days I will not do it for David thy father’s sake: \add but\add* I will rend it out of the hand of thy son.
Howbeit I will not rend away all the kingdom ; \add but\add* will give one tribe to thy son for David my servant’s sake, and for Jerusalem’s sake which I have chosen. \p
¶ And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* stirred up an adversary unto Solomon , Hadad the Edomite : he \add was\add* of the king’s seed in Edom.
For it came to pass, when David was in Edom , and Joab the captain of the host was gone up to bury the slain , after he had smitten every male in Edom ;
(For six months did Joab remain there with all Israel , until he had cut off every male in Edom :)
That Hadad fled , he and certain Edomites of his father’s servants with him, to go into Egypt ; Hadad \add being\add* yet a little child.

And they arose out of Midian , and came to Paran : and they took men with them out of Paran , and they came to Egypt , unto Pharaoh king of Egypt ; which gave him an house , and appointed him victuals , and gave him land.
And Hadad found great favour in the sight of Pharaoh , so that he gave him to wife the sister of his own wife , the sister of Tahpenes the queen.
And the sister of Tahpenes bare him Genubath his son , whom Tahpenes weaned in Pharaoh’s house : and Genubath was in Pharaoh’s household among the sons of Pharaoh.

And when Hadad heard in Egypt that David slept with his fathers , and that Joab the captain of the host was dead , Hadad said to Pharaoh , Let me depart , that I may go to mine own country.\f + \fr 11.21 \ft Let…: Heb. Send me away\f*

Then Pharaoh said unto him, But what hast thou lacked with me, that, behold, thou seekest to go to thine own country ? And he answered , Nothing: howbeit let me go in any wise.\f + \fr 11.22 \ft Nothing: Heb. Not\f* \p
¶ And God stirred him up \add another\add* adversary , Rezon the son of Eliadah , which fled from his lord Hadadezer king of Zobah :
And he gathered men unto him, and became captain over a band , when David slew them \add of Zobah:\add* and they went to Damascus , and dwelt therein, and reigned in Damascus.
And he was an adversary to Israel all the days of Solomon , beside the mischief that Hadad \add did:\add* and he abhorred Israel , and reigned over Syria. \p
¶ And Jeroboam the son of Nebat , an Ephrathite of Zereda , Solomon’s servant , whose mother’s name \add was\add* Zeruah , a widow woman , even he lifted up \add his\add* hand against the king.

And this \add was\add* the cause that he lifted up \add his\add* hand against the king : Solomon built Millo , \add and\add* repaired the breaches of the city of David his father.\f + \fr 11.27 \ft repaired: Heb. closed\f*

And the man Jeroboam \add was\add* a mighty man of valour : and Solomon seeing the young man that he was industrious , he made him ruler over all the charge of the house of Joseph.\f + \fr 11.28 \ft was industrious: Heb. did work\f*\f + \fr 11.28 \ft charge: Heb. burden\f*

And it came to pass at that time when Jeroboam went out of Jerusalem , that the prophet Ahijah the Shilonite found him in the way ; and he had clad himself with a new garment ; and they two \add were\add* alone in the field :
And Ahijah caught the new garment that \add was\add* on him, and rent it \add in\add* twelve pieces :

And he said to Jeroboam , Take thee ten pieces : for thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, the God of Israel , Behold, I will rend the kingdom out of the hand of Solomon , and will give ten tribes to thee:
(But he shall have one tribe for my servant David’s sake, and for Jerusalem’s sake, the city which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel :)

Because that they have forsaken me, and have worshipped Ashtoreth the goddess of the Zidonians , Chemosh the god of the Moabites , and Milcom the god of the children of Ammon , and have not walked in my ways , to do \add that which is\add* right in mine eyes , and \add to keep\add* my statutes and my judgments , as \add did\add* David his father.

Howbeit I will not take the whole kingdom out of his hand : but I will make him prince all the days of his life for David my servant’s sake, whom I chose , because he kept my commandments and my statutes :
But I will take the kingdom out of his son’s hand , and will give it unto thee, \add even\add* ten tribes.

And unto his son will I give one tribe , that David my servant may have a light alway before me in Jerusalem , the city which I have chosen me to put my name there.\f + \fr 11.36 \ft light: Heb. lamp, or, candle\f*
And I will take thee, and thou shalt reign according to all that thy soul desireth , and shalt be king over Israel.

And it shall be, if thou wilt hearken unto all that I command thee, and wilt walk in my ways , and do \add that is\add* right in my sight , to keep my statutes and my commandments , as David my servant did ; that I will be with thee, and build thee a sure house , as I built for David , and will give Israel unto thee.
And I will for this afflict the seed of David , but not for ever.
Solomon sought therefore to kill Jeroboam. And Jeroboam arose , and fled into Egypt , unto Shishak king of Egypt , and was in Egypt until the death of Solomon. \p
¶ And the rest of the acts of Solomon , and all that he did , and his wisdom , \add are\add* they not written in the book of the acts of Solomon ?\f + \fr 11.41 \ft acts: or, words, or, things\f*
And the time that Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel \add was\add* forty years.\f + \fr 11.42 \ft time: Heb. days\f*
And Solomon slept with his fathers , and was buried in the city of David his father : and Rehoboam his son reigned in his stead.\f + \fr 11.43 \ft Rehoboam: Gr. Roboam\f*
